entry.title: Intro: A port of Inferno-os on gec6410
entry.content:
Here are some tutorials of porting inferno-os, we hope these tutorials can help you.

Inferno-os is a distributed operating system, originally developed at Bell labs.Applications written in Inferno’s concurrent programming language, Limbo, are compiled to its portable virtual machine code (Dis), to run anywhere on a network in the portable environment that Inferno provides. Unusually, that environment looks and acts like a complete operating system.

During the time when we port it on ARM-gec6410, the port on Raspberry Pi helped us a lot. View it on Labs: Porting Inferno OS to Raspberry Pi.

As LYNXLINE has been given the way following with you can have a clear clue to port inferno-os on any board based on arm, here we just show some differences between the gec6410 and raspberry-pi.
